FUSO INSULAR
pt

OPEN CALL 2023

This year’s OPEN CALL at the FUSO festival received a record number of 271 works in competition, highlighting the very latest in video art being produced in Portuguese territory.

Curator Jean-François Chougnet selected 12 works that translate into images, letters, words, sounds and bodies the issues that cross our societies.

Selected Artists and Works: 

António Olaio: I’m beaming my dreams into your head, 2023

Beatriz Soares Dias e Francisca Manuel: Escória, 2021

Francisca Dores: How to be a candid woman, 2022

Ian Capillé: ensaio para sonho, 2023

João Saramago: Betrayal, 2022

Lula Pena: La femme tranquille de la tribu, 2023

Maria Peixoto Martins: Pi Pi Pi Pi Pi, 2022

Miguel Leonardo: O Rapaz Que Pensava Demais, 2022

Rafael Raposo Pires: Ruídos da espera, 2021

Ricardo Leandro: Excerto de uma cegada, 2021

Sarah Legow: Dear Ceiling, 2022

Sofia Santa-Rita: Vozes Pictóricas, 2023

The videos will be presented at the session taking place at MAAT - Museu de Arte, Arquitectura e Tecnologia, on the 23rd of August, and compete for the Fundação EDP/MAAT Acquisition Prize for the jury’s choice of the best work and the DUPLACENA Incentive Prize for the public’s choice.

Open Call Jury 2023
Margarida Chantre (EDP/MAAT), Irit Batsry (artist), Isabel Nogueira (historian and art critic), Maxime Martinot (Open Call 2022 winner) and Susana De Sousa Dias (film director)

Congratulations to those selected and our sincere thanks to all those who sent us their works for the contest!
